config.question: Why do the authors call the Naturalization Law the most flagrantly political of the four bills under the Alien and Sedition Acts?

choices.content: It was designed to limit Republicans in the electorate.
It forbade U.S. citizens from having any kind of negotiation with foreign governments.
It gave the president the right to revoke permits given to any business or manufacturing units owned by foreigners.
It allowed the president to expel any foreigner from the United States by executive decree.

answer_3.response: The Naturalization Law established a 14-year probationary period before foreigners could apply for U.S. citizenship. This prevented many recent immigrants who supported the Republicans from voting.
